verses.name: Job 3:10
verses.text: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.

verses.name: Job 3:11
verses.text: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?

verses.name: Job 3:12
verses.text: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?

verses.name: Job 3:13
verses.text: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

verses.name: Job 3:14
verses.text: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;

verses.name: Job 3:15
verses.text: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:
